 102# https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/notes/hip.html#checking-for-hip
 103def is_hip() -> bool:
 104    return torch.version.hip is not None
 105
 106
 107if is_hip():
 108    FP8_E4M3_MAX = HIP_FP8_E4M3_FNUZ_MAX
 109else:
 110    FP8_E4M3_MAX = torch.finfo(torch.float8_e4m3fn).max
 111
 112FP8_E4M3_MIN = -FP8_E4M3_MAX
 113
 114builtins.FP8_E4M3_MAX = FP8_E4M3_MAX
 115builtins.FP8_E4M3_MIN = FP8_E4M3_MIN

 138def is_host_cpu_x86() -> bool:
 139    machine = platform.machine().lower()
 140    return (
 141        machine in ("x86_64", "amd64", "i386", "i686")
 142        and hasattr(torch, "cpu")
 143        and torch.cpu.is_available()
 144    )
 145
 146
 147def is_cpu() -> bool:
 148    return os.getenv("SGLANG_USE_CPU_ENGINE", "0") == "1" and is_host_cpu_x86()
 149

 151def get_cuda_version():
 152    if torch.version.cuda:
 153        return tuple(map(int, torch.version.cuda.split(".")))
 154    return (0, 0)

 157def _check(cc_major):
 158    if not is_cuda():
 159        return False
 160    return torch.cuda.get_device_capability()[0] == cc_major and tuple(
 161        map(int, torch.version.cuda.split(".")[:2])
 162    ) >= (12, 3)
 163
 164
 165is_ampere_with_cuda_12_3 = lambda: _check(8)
 166is_hopper_with_cuda_12_3 = lambda: _check(9)
 167
 168
 169def is_blackwell():
 170    if not is_cuda():
 171        return False
 172    return torch.cuda.get_device_capability()[0] == 10

 175@lru_cache(maxsize=1)
 176def is_sm100_supported(device=None) -> bool:
 177    return (torch.cuda.get_device_capability(device)[0] == 10) and (
 178        torch.version.cuda >= "12.8"
 179    )
 180
 181
 182@lru_cache(maxsize=1)
 183def is_sm90_supported(device=None) -> bool:
 184    return (torch.cuda.get_device_capability(device)[0] == 9) and (
 185        torch.version.cuda >= "12.3"
 186    )

 189_warned_bool_env_var_keys = set()
 190
 191
 192def get_bool_env_var(name: str, default: str = "false") -> bool:
 193    value = os.getenv(name, default)
 194    value = value.lower()
 195
 196    truthy_values = ("true", "1")
 197    falsy_values = ("false", "0")
 198
 199    if (value not in truthy_values) and (value not in falsy_values):
 200        if value not in _warned_bool_env_var_keys:
 201            logger.warning(
 202                f"get_bool_env_var({name}) see non-understandable value={value} and treat as false"
 203            )
 204        _warned_bool_env_var_keys.add(value)
 205
 206    return value in truthy_values
 207
 208
 209def get_int_env_var(name: str, default: int = 0) -> int:
 210    value = os.getenv(name)
 211    if value is None or not value.strip():
 212        return default
 213    try:
 214        return int(value)
 215    except ValueError:
 216        return default

 241def is_flashinfer_available():
 242    """
 243    Check whether flashinfer is available.
 244    As of Oct. 6, 2024, it is only available on NVIDIA GPUs.
 245    """
 246    if not get_bool_env_var("SGLANG_IS_FLASHINFER_AVAILABLE", default="true"):
 247        return False
 248    return importlib.util.find_spec("flashinfer") is not None and is_cuda()

 256    "SGLANG_ENABLE_TORCH_INFERENCE_MODE", "false"

 260class DynamicGradMode(_DecoratorContextManager):
 261    """
 262    A combination of torch.no_grad and torch.inference_mode,
 263    with their behavior controlled by an environment variable. Just refer to them.
 264    """
 265
 266    @staticmethod
 267    def set_inference_mode(mode: bool):
 268        if isinstance(mode, bool):
 269            global _ENABLE_TORCH_INFERENCE_MODE
 270
 271            _ENABLE_TORCH_INFERENCE_MODE = mode
 272        else:
 273            logger.warning("mode is not a boolean object")
 274
 275    def __init__(self, mode=True):
 276        if not torch._jit_internal.is_scripting():
 277            super().__init__()
 278        if _ENABLE_TORCH_INFERENCE_MODE:
 279            self.mode = mode
 280        else:
 281            self.prev = False
 282
 283    def __new__(cls, mode_or_orig_func=True if _ENABLE_TORCH_INFERENCE_MODE else None):
 284        if mode_or_orig_func is None or isinstance(mode_or_orig_func, bool):
 285            return super().__new__(cls)
 286        return cls()(mode_or_orig_func)
 287
 288    def __enter__(self) -> None:
 289        if _ENABLE_TORCH_INFERENCE_MODE:
 290            self._inference_mode_context = torch._C._InferenceMode(self.mode)
 291            self._inference_mode_context.__enter__()
 292        else:
 293            self.prev = torch.is_grad_enabled()
 294            torch.set_grad_enabled(False)
 295
 296    def __exit__(self, exc_type: Any, exc_value: Any, traceback: Any) -> None:
 297        if _ENABLE_TORCH_INFERENCE_MODE:
 298            self._inference_mode_context.__exit__(exc_type, exc_value, traceback)
 299        else:
 300            torch.set_grad_enabled(self.prev)
 301
 302    def clone(self) -> "DynamicGradMode":
 303        r"""
 304        Create a copy of this class
 305        """
 306        if _ENABLE_TORCH_INFERENCE_MODE:
 307            return self.__class__(self.mode)
 308        else:
 309            return self.__class__()
 310

 312def enable_show_time_cost():
 313    global show_time_cost
 314    show_time_cost = True
 315
 316
 317class TimeInfo:
 318    def __init__(self, name, interval=0.1, color=0, indent=0):
 319        self.name = name
 320        self.interval = interval
 321        self.color = color
 322        self.indent = indent
 323
 324        self.acc_time = 0
 325        self.last_acc_time = 0
 326
 327    def check(self):
 328        if self.acc_time - self.last_acc_time > self.interval:
 329            self.last_acc_time = self.acc_time
 330            return True
 331        return False
 332
 333    def pretty_print(self):
 334        print(f"\x1b[{self.color}m", end="")
 335        print("-" * self.indent * 2, end="")
 336        print(f"{self.name}: {self.acc_time:.3f}s\x1b[0m")
 337
 338
 339def mark_start(name, interval=0.1, color=0, indent=0):
 340    global time_infos, show_time_cost
 341    if not show_time_cost:
 342        return
 343    torch.cuda.synchronize()
 344    if time_infos.get(name, None) is None:
 345        time_infos[name] = TimeInfo(name, interval, color, indent)
 346    time_infos[name].acc_time -= time.perf_counter()
 347
 348
 349def mark_end(name):
 350    global time_infos, show_time_cost
 351    if not show_time_cost:
 352        return
 353    torch.cuda.synchronize()
 354    time_infos[name].acc_time += time.perf_counter()
 355    if time_infos[name].check():
 356        time_infos[name].pretty_print()
 357
 358
 359def calculate_time(show=False, min_cost_ms=0.0):
 360    def wrapper(func):
 361        def inner_func(*args, **kwargs):
 362            torch.cuda.synchronize()
 363            if show:
 364                start_time = time.perf_counter()
 365            result = func(*args, **kwargs)
 366            torch.cuda.synchronize()
 367            if show:
 368                cost_time = (time.perf_counter() - start_time) * 1000
 369                if cost_time > min_cost_ms:
 370                    print(f"Function {func.__name__} took {cost_time} ms to run.")
 371            return result
 372
 373        return inner_func
 374
 375    return wrapper
 376

 378def get_available_gpu_memory(
 379    device, gpu_id, distributed=False, empty_cache=True, cpu_group=None
 380):
 381    """
 382    Get available memory for cuda:gpu_id device.
 383    When distributed is True, the available memory is the minimum available memory of all GPUs.
 384    """
 385    if device == "cuda":
 386        num_gpus = torch.cuda.device_count()
 387        assert gpu_id < num_gpus
 388
 389        if torch.cuda.current_device() != gpu_id:
 390            print(
 391                f"WARNING: current device is not {gpu_id}, but {torch.cuda.current_device()}, ",
 392                "which may cause useless memory allocation for torch CUDA context.",
 393            )
 394
 395        if empty_cache:
 396            torch.cuda.empty_cache()
 397        free_gpu_memory, _ = torch.cuda.mem_get_info(gpu_id)
 398
 399    elif device == "xpu":
 400        num_gpus = torch.xpu.device_count()
 401        assert gpu_id < num_gpus
 402
 403        if torch.xpu.current_device() != gpu_id:
 404            print(
 405                f"WARNING: current device is not {gpu_id}, but {torch.xpu.current_device()}, ",
 406                "which may cause useless memory allocation for torch XPU context.",
 407            )
 408
 409        if empty_cache:
 410            torch.xpu.empty_cache()
 411        used_memory = torch.xpu.memory_allocated()
 412        total_gpu_memory = torch.xpu.get_device_properties(gpu_id).total_memory
 413        free_gpu_memory = total_gpu_memory - used_memory
 414
 415    elif device == "hpu":
 416        num_gpus = torch.hpu.device_count()
 417        assert gpu_id < num_gpus
 418
 419        if torch.hpu.current_device() != gpu_id:
 420            print(
 421                f"WARNING: current device is not {gpu_id}, but {torch.hpu.current_device()}, ",
 422                "which may cause useless memory allocation for torch HPU context.",
 423            )
 424
 425        free_gpu_memory, total_gpu_memory = torch.hpu.mem_get_info()
 426
 427    elif device == "cpu":
 428        # TODO: rename the variables in the current function to be not GPU specific
 429        free_gpu_memory = psutil.virtual_memory().available
 430    elif device == "npu":
 431        num_gpus = torch.npu.device_count()
 432        assert gpu_id < num_gpus
 433
 434        if torch.npu.current_device() != gpu_id:
 435            print(
 436                f"WARNING: current device is not {gpu_id}, but {torch.npu.current_device()}, ",
 437                "which may cause useless memory allocation for torch NPU context.",
 438            )
 439        free_gpu_memory, total_gpu_memory = torch.npu.mem_get_info()
 440
 441    if distributed:
 442        tensor = torch.tensor(free_gpu_memory, dtype=torch.float32)
 443        torch.distributed.all_reduce(
 444            tensor, op=torch.distributed.ReduceOp.MIN, group=cpu_group
 445        )
 446        free_gpu_memory = tensor.item()
 447
 448    return free_gpu_memory / (1 << 30)
 449

 451def is_pin_memory_available() -> bool:
 452    return torch.cuda.is_available()

 454
 455class LayerFn(Protocol):
 456
 457    def __call__(self, layer_id: int, prefix: str) -> torch.nn.Module: ...
 458
 459
 460def make_layers(
 461    num_hidden_layers: int,
 462    layer_fn: LayerFn,
 463    pp_rank: Optional[int] = None,
 464    pp_size: Optional[int] = None,
 465    prefix: str = "",
 466    return_tuple: bool = False,
 467    offloader_kwargs: Dict[str, Any] = {},
 468) -> Tuple[int, int, torch.nn.ModuleList]:
 469    """Make a list of layers with the given layer function"""
 470    # circula imports
 471    from sglang.srt.distributed import get_pp_indices
 472    from sglang.srt.layers.utils import PPMissingLayer
 473    from sglang.srt.offloader import get_offloader
 474
 475    assert not pp_size or num_hidden_layers >= pp_size
 476    start_layer, end_layer = (
 477        get_pp_indices(
 478            num_hidden_layers,
 479            pp_rank,
 480            pp_size,
 481        )
 482        if pp_rank is not None and pp_size is not None
 483        else (0, num_hidden_layers)
 484    )
 485    modules = torch.nn.ModuleList(
 486        [PPMissingLayer(return_tuple=return_tuple) for _ in range(start_layer)]
 487        + get_offloader().wrap_modules(
 488            (
 489                layer_fn(idx=idx, prefix=add_prefix(idx, prefix))
 490                for idx in range(start_layer, end_layer)
 491            ),
 492            **offloader_kwargs,
 493        )
 494        + [
 495            PPMissingLayer(return_tuple=return_tuple)
 496            for _ in range(end_layer, num_hidden_layers)
 497        ]
 498    )
 499    if pp_rank is None or pp_size is None:
 500        return modules
 501    return modules, start_layer, end_layer
 502

 504def set_random_seed(seed: int) -> None:
 505    """Set the random seed for all libraries."""
 506    random.seed(seed)
 507    np.random.seed(seed)
 508    torch.manual_seed(seed)
 509    if torch.cuda.is_available():
 510        torch.cuda.manual_seed_all(seed)
 511
 512
 513def find_process_using_port(port: int) -> Optional[psutil.Process]:
 514    for conn in psutil.net_connections(kind="inet"):
 515        if conn.laddr.port == port:
 516            try:
 517                return psutil.Process(conn.pid)
 518            except psutil.NoSuchProcess:
 519                # It could happen by race condition (the proc dies when psutil.Process is called).
 520                pass
 521
 522    return None
 523
 524
 525def wait_port_available(
 526    port: int, port_name: str, timeout_s: int = 30, raise_exception: bool = True
 527) -> bool:
 528    for i in range(timeout_s):
 529        if is_port_available(port):
 530            return True
 531
 532        if i > 10 and i % 5 == 0:
 533            process = find_process_using_port(port)
 534            if process is None:
 535                logger.warning(
 536                    f"The port {port} is in use, but we could not find the process that uses it."
 537                )
 538
 539            pid = process.pid
 540            error_message = f"{port_name} is used by a process already. {process.name()=}' {process.cmdline()=} {process.status()=} {pid=}"
 541            logger.info(
 542                f"port {port} is in use. Waiting for {i} seconds for {port_name} to be available. {error_message}"
 543            )
 544        time.sleep(0.1)
 545
 546    if raise_exception:
 547        raise ValueError(
 548            f"{port_name} at {port} is not available in {timeout_s} seconds. {error_message}"
 549        )
 550    return False
 551
 552
 553def is_port_available(port):
 554    """Return whether a port is available."""
 555    with socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM) as s:
 556        try:
 557            s.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_REUSEADDR, 1)
 558            s.bind(("", port))
 559            s.listen(1)
 560            return True
 561        except socket.error:
 562            return False
 563        except OverflowError:
 564            return False
 565
 566
 567def get_free_port():
 568    # try ipv4
 569    try:
 570        with socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM) as s:
 571            s.bind(("", 0))
 572            return s.getsockname()[1]
 573    except OSError:
 574        # try ipv6
 575        with socket.socket(socket.AF_INET6, socket.SOCK_STREAM) as s:
 576            s.bind(("", 0))
 577            return s.getsockname()[1]

 580def decode_video_base64(video_base64):
 581    from PIL import Image
 582
 583    # Decode the base64 string
 584    video_bytes = pybase64.b64decode(video_base64, validate=True)
 585
 586    # Placeholder for the start indices of each PNG image
 587    img_starts = []
 588
 589    frame_format = "PNG"  # str(os.getenv('FRAME_FORMAT', "JPEG"))
 590
 591    assert frame_format in [
 592        "PNG",
 593        "JPEG",
 594    ], "FRAME_FORMAT must be either 'PNG' or 'JPEG'"
 595
 596    if frame_format == "PNG":
 597        # Find each PNG start signature to isolate images
 598        i = 0
 599        while i < len(video_bytes) - 7:  # Adjusted for the length of the PNG signature
 600            # Check if we found the start of a PNG file
 601            if (
 602                video_bytes[i] == 0x89
 603                and video_bytes[i + 1] == 0x50
 604                and video_bytes[i + 2] == 0x4E
 605                and video_bytes[i + 3] == 0x47
 606                and video_bytes[i + 4] == 0x0D
 607                and video_bytes[i + 5] == 0x0A
 608                and video_bytes[i + 6] == 0x1A
 609                and video_bytes[i + 7] == 0x0A
 610            ):
 611                img_starts.append(i)
 612                i += 8  # Skip the PNG signature
 613            else:
 614                i += 1
 615    else:
 616        # Find each JPEG start (0xFFD8) to isolate images
 617        i = 0
 618        while (
 619            i < len(video_bytes) - 1
 620        ):  # Adjusted for the length of the JPEG SOI signature
 621            # Check if we found the start of a JPEG file
 622            if video_bytes[i] == 0xFF and video_bytes[i + 1] == 0xD8:
 623                img_starts.append(i)
 624                # Move to the next byte to continue searching for the next image start
 625                i += 2
 626            else:
 627                i += 1
 628
 629    frames = []
 630    for start_idx in img_starts:
 631        # Assuming each image is back-to-back, the end of one image is the start of another
 632        # The last image goes until the end of the byte string
 633        end_idx = (
 634            img_starts[img_starts.index(start_idx) + 1]
 635            if img_starts.index(start_idx) + 1 < len(img_starts)
 636            else len(video_bytes)
 637        )
 638        img_bytes = video_bytes[start_idx:end_idx]
 639
 640        # Convert bytes to a PIL Image
 641        img = Image.open(BytesIO(img_bytes))
 642
 643        # Convert PIL Image to a NumPy array
 644        frame = np.array(img)
 645
 646        # Append the frame to the list of frames
 647        frames.append(frame)
 648
 649    # Ensure there's at least one frame to avoid errors with np.stack
 650    if frames:
 651        return np.stack(frames, axis=0), img.size
 652    else:
 653        return np.array([]), (
 654            0,
 655            0,
 656        )  # Return an empty array and size tuple if no frames were found
 657
 658
 659def load_audio(
 660    audio_file: str, sr: Optional[int] = None, mono: bool = True
 661) -> np.ndarray:
 662    # Use soundfile here, since librosa use it under the hood,
 663    # and librosa will not support audio loading in the future
 664    import soundfile as sf
 665    from scipy.signal import resample
 666
 667    if sr is None:
 668        sr = 16000
 669
 670    # Load audio data
 671    if isinstance(audio_file, bytes):
 672        audio, original_sr = sf.read(BytesIO(audio_file))
 673    elif audio_file.startswith("data:"):
 674        audio_file = audio_file.split(",")[1]
 675        audio, original_sr = sf.read(
 676            BytesIO(pybase64.b64decode(audio_file, validate=True))
 677        )
 678    elif audio_file.startswith("http://") or audio_file.startswith("https://"):
 679        timeout = int(os.getenv("REQUEST_TIMEOUT", "5"))
 680        response = requests.get(audio_file, stream=True, timeout=timeout)
 681        audio_file = BytesIO(response.content)
 682        response.close()
 683        audio, original_sr = sf.read(audio_file)
 684    elif isinstance(audio_file, str):
 685        audio, original_sr = sf.read(audio_file)
 686    else:
 687        raise ValueError(f"Invalid audio format: {audio_file}")
 688
 689    # Resample audio if the original sample rate is different from the desired sample rate
 690    if original_sr != sr:
 691        num_samples = int(len(audio) * float(sr) / original_sr)
 692        audio = resample(audio, num_samples)
 693
 694    # Convert to mono if requested and audio is stereo
 695    if mono and len(audio.shape) > 1:
 696        audio = np.mean(audio, axis=1)
 697
 698    return audio
 699

 701@dataclass
 702class ImageData:
 703    url: str
 704    detail: Optional[Literal["auto", "low", "high"]] = "auto"
 705
 706
 707def load_image(
 708    image_file: Union[Image.Image, str, ImageData, bytes],
 709) -> tuple[Image.Image, tuple[int, int]]:
 710    if isinstance(image_file, ImageData):
 711        image_file = image_file.url
 712
 713    image = image_size = None
 714    if isinstance(image_file, Image.Image):
 715        image = image_file
 716        image_size = (image.width, image.height)
 717    elif isinstance(image_file, bytes):
 718        image = Image.open(BytesIO(image_file))
 719    elif image_file.startswith("http://") or image_file.startswith("https://"):
 720        timeout = int(os.getenv("REQUEST_TIMEOUT", "3"))
 721        response = requests.get(image_file, stream=True, timeout=timeout)
 722        try:
 723            response.raise_for_status()
 724            image = Image.open(response.raw)
 725            image.load()  # Force loading to avoid issues after closing the stream
 726        finally:
 727            response.close()
 728    elif image_file.lower().endswith(("png", "jpg", "jpeg", "webp", "gif")):
 729        image = Image.open(image_file)
 730    elif image_file.startswith("data:"):
 731        image_file = image_file.split(",")[1]
 732        image = Image.open(BytesIO(pybase64.b64decode(image_file, validate=True)))
 733    elif isinstance(image_file, str):
 734        image = Image.open(BytesIO(pybase64.b64decode(image_file, validate=True)))
 735    else:
 736        raise ValueError(f"Invalid image: {image_file}")
 737
 738    return image, image_size
 739

 741def load_video(video_file: Union[str, bytes], use_gpu: bool = True):
 742    # We import decord here to avoid a strange Segmentation fault (core dumped) issue.
 743    from decord import VideoReader, cpu, gpu
 744
 745    try:
 746        from decord.bridge import decord_bridge
 747
 748        ctx = gpu(0)
 749        _ = decord_bridge.get_ctx_device(ctx)
 750    except Exception:
 751        ctx = cpu(0)
 752
 753    tmp_file = None
 754    vr = None
 755    try:
 756        if isinstance(video_file, bytes):
 757            tmp_file = tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(delete=False, suffix=".mp4")
 758            tmp_file.write(video_file)
 759            tmp_file.close()
 760            vr = VideoReader(tmp_file.name, ctx=ctx)
 761        elif isinstance(video_file, str):
 762            if video_file.startswith(("http://", "https://")):
 763                timeout = int(os.getenv("REQUEST_TIMEOUT", "10"))
 764                response = requests.get(video_file, stream=True, timeout=timeout)
 765                response.raise_for_status()
 766                tmp_file = tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(delete=False, suffix=".mp4")
 767                for chunk in response.iter_content(chunk_size=8192):
 768                    tmp_file.write(chunk)
 769                tmp_file.close()
 770                vr = VideoReader(tmp_file.name, ctx=ctx)
 771            elif video_file.startswith("data:"):
 772                _, encoded = video_file.split(",", 1)
 773                video_bytes = pybase64.b64decode(encoded)
 774                tmp_file = tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(delete=False, suffix=".mp4")
 775                tmp_file.write(video_bytes)
 776                tmp_file.close()
 777                vr = VideoReader(tmp_file.name, ctx=ctx)
 778            elif os.path.isfile(video_file):
 779                vr = VideoReader(video_file, ctx=ctx)
 780            else:
 781                video_bytes = pybase64.b64decode(video_file)
 782                tmp_file = tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(delete=False, suffix=".mp4")
 783                tmp_file.write(video_bytes)
 784                tmp_file.close()
 785                vr = VideoReader(tmp_file.name, ctx=ctx)
 786        else:
 787            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported video input type: {type(video_file)}")
 788
 789        return vr
 790
 791    finally:
 792        if tmp_file and os.path.exists(tmp_file.name):
 793            os.unlink(tmp_file.name)
 794

 816def assert_pkg_version(pkg: str, min_version: str, message: str):
 817    try:
 818        installed_version = version(pkg)
 819        if pkg_version.parse(installed_version) < pkg_version.parse(min_version):
 820            raise Exception(
 821                f"{pkg} is installed with version {installed_version}, which "
 822                f"is less than the minimum required version {min_version}. " + message
 823            )
 824    except PackageNotFoundError:
 825        raise Exception(
 826            f"{pkg} with minimum required version {min_version} is not installed. "
 827            + message
 828        )

 831def kill_process_tree(parent_pid, include_parent: bool = True, skip_pid: int = None):
 832    """Kill the process and all its child processes."""
 833    # Remove sigchld handler to avoid spammy logs.
 834    if threading.current_thread() is threading.main_thread():
 835        signal.signal(signal.SIGCHLD, signal.SIG_DFL)
 836
 837    if parent_pid is None:
 838        parent_pid = os.getpid()
 839        include_parent = False
 840
 841    try:
 842        itself = psutil.Process(parent_pid)
 843    except psutil.NoSuchProcess:
 844        return
 845
 846    children = itself.children(recursive=True)
 847    for child in children:
 848        if child.pid == skip_pid:
 849            continue
 850        try:
 851            child.kill()
 852        except psutil.NoSuchProcess:
 853            pass
 854
 855    if include_parent:
 856        try:
 857            if parent_pid == os.getpid():
 858                itself.kill()
 859                sys.exit(0)
 860
 861            itself.kill()
 862
 863            # Sometime processes cannot be killed with SIGKILL (e.g, PID=1 launched by kubernetes),
 864            # so we send an additional signal to kill them.
 865            itself.send_signal(signal.SIGQUIT)
 866        except psutil.NoSuchProcess:
 867            pass

 888def monkey_patch_vllm_gguf_config():

 902        self, layer: torch.nn.Module, prefix: str

 914def set_ulimit(target_soft_limit=65535):
 915    # number of open files
 916    resource_type = resource.RLIMIT_NOFILE
 917    current_soft, current_hard = resource.getrlimit(resource_type)
 918
 919    if current_soft < target_soft_limit:
 920        try:
 921            resource.setrlimit(resource_type, (target_soft_limit, current_hard))
 922        except ValueError as e:
 923            logger.warning(f"Fail to set RLIMIT_NOFILE: {e}")
 924
 925    # stack size
 926    resource_type = resource.RLIMIT_STACK
 927    current_soft, current_hard = resource.getrlimit(resource_type)
 928    target_soft_limit_stack_size = 1024 * target_soft_limit
 929    if current_soft < target_soft_limit_stack_size:
 930        try:
 931            resource.setrlimit(
 932                resource_type, (target_soft_limit_stack_size, current_hard)
 933            )
 934        except ValueError as e:
 935            logger.warning(f"Fail to set RLIMIT_STACK: {e}")

 938def add_api_key_middleware(app, api_key: str):
 939    @app.middleware("http")
 940    async def authentication(request, call_next):
 941        if request.method == "OPTIONS":
 942            return await call_next(request)
 943        if request.url.path.startswith("/health"):
 944            return await call_next(request)
 945        if request.url.path.startswith("/metrics"):
 946            return await call_next(request)
 947        if request.headers.get("Authorization") != "Bearer " + api_key:
 948            return ORJSONResponse(content={"error": "Unauthorized"}, status_code=401)
 949        return await call_next(request)

 964def configure_logger(server_args, prefix: str = ""):
 965    if SGLANG_LOGGING_CONFIG_PATH := os.getenv("SGLANG_LOGGING_CONFIG_PATH"):
 966        if not os.path.exists(SGLANG_LOGGING_CONFIG_PATH):
 967            raise Exception(
 968                "Setting SGLANG_LOGGING_CONFIG_PATH from env with "
 969                f"{SGLANG_LOGGING_CONFIG_PATH} but it does not exist!"
 970            )
 971        with open(SGLANG_LOGGING_CONFIG_PATH, encoding="utf-8") as file:
 972            custom_config = json.loads(file.read())
 973        logging.config.dictConfig(custom_config)
 974        return
 975    format = f"[%(asctime)s{prefix}] %(message)s"
 976    # format = f"[%(asctime)s.%(msecs)03d{prefix}] %(message)s"
 977    logging.basicConfig(
 978        level=getattr(logging, server_args.log_level.upper()),
 979        format=format,
 980        datefmt="%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S",
 981        force=True,
 982    )

 985# source: https://github.com/vllm-project/vllm/blob/93b38bea5dd03e1b140ca997dfaadef86f8f1855/vllm/lora/utils.py#L9
 986def replace_submodule(
 987    model: nn.Module, module_name: str, new_module: nn.Module
 988) -> nn.Module:
 989    """Replace a submodule in a model with a new module."""
 990    parent = model.get_submodule(".".join(module_name.split(".")[:-1]))
 991    target_name = module_name.split(".")[-1]
 992    setattr(parent, target_name, new_module)
 993    return new_module

 996def set_weight_attrs(
 997    weight: torch.Tensor,
 998    weight_attrs: Optional[Dict[str, Any]],
 999):
1000    """Set attributes on a weight tensor.
1001
1002    This method is used to set attributes on a weight tensor. This method
1003    will not overwrite existing attributes.
1004
1005    Args:
1006        weight: The weight tensor.
1007        weight_attrs: A dictionary of attributes to set on the weight tensor.
1008    """
1009    if weight_attrs is None:
1010        return
1011    for key, value in weight_attrs.items():
1012        assert not hasattr(weight, key), f"Overwriting existing tensor attribute: {key}"
1013        setattr(weight, key, value)

1016def broadcast_pyobj(
1017    data: List[Any],
1018    rank: int,
1019    dist_group: Optional[torch.distributed.ProcessGroup] = None,
1020    src: int = 0,
1021    force_cpu_device: bool = True,
1022):
1023    """Broadcast inputs from src rank to all other ranks with torch.dist backend.
1024    The `rank` here refer to the source rank on global process group (regardless
1025    of dist_group argument).
1026    """
1027    device = torch.device(
1028        "cuda" if torch.cuda.is_available() and not force_cpu_device else "cpu"
1029    )
1030
1031    if rank == src:
1032        if len(data) == 0:
1033            tensor_size = torch.tensor([0], dtype=torch.long, device=device)
1034            dist.broadcast(tensor_size, src=src, group=dist_group)
1035        else:
1036            serialized_data = pickle.dumps(data)
1037            size = len(serialized_data)
1038
1039            tensor_data = torch.ByteTensor(
1040                np.frombuffer(serialized_data, dtype=np.uint8)
1041            ).to(device)
1042            tensor_size = torch.tensor([size], dtype=torch.long, device=device)
1043
1044            dist.broadcast(tensor_size, src=src, group=dist_group)
1045            dist.broadcast(tensor_data, src=src, group=dist_group)
1046        return data
1047    else:
1048        tensor_size = torch.tensor([0], dtype=torch.long, device=device)
1049        dist.broadcast(tensor_size, src=src, group=dist_group)
1050        size = tensor_size.item()
1051
1052        if size == 0:
1053            return []
1054
1055        tensor_data = torch.empty(size, dtype=torch.uint8, device=device)
1056        dist.broadcast(tensor_data, src=src, group=dist_group)
1057
1058        serialized_data = bytes(tensor_data.cpu().numpy())
1059        data = pickle.loads(serialized_data)
1060        return data
1061
1062
1063def point_to_point_pyobj(
1064    data: List[Any],
1065    rank: int,
1066    group: Optional[torch.distributed.ProcessGroup] = None,
1067    src: int = 0,
1068    dst: int = 1,
1069):
1070    """Send data from src to dst in group using DeviceToDevice communication."""
1071
1072    if rank == src:
1073        if len(data) == 0:
1074            tensor_size = torch.tensor(
1075                [0], dtype=torch.long, device=torch.cuda.current_device()
1076            )
1077            dist.send(tensor_size, dst=dst, group=group)
1078        else:
1079            serialized_data = pickle.dumps(data)
1080            size = len(serialized_data)
1081            tensor_data = torch.ByteTensor(
1082                np.frombuffer(serialized_data, dtype=np.uint8)
1083            ).cuda(
1084                device=torch.cuda.current_device()
1085            )  # Move to GPU
1086            tensor_size = torch.tensor(
1087                [size], dtype=torch.long, device=torch.cuda.current_device()
1088            )
1089
1090            dist.send(tensor_size, dst=dst, group=group)
1091            dist.send(tensor_data, dst=dst, group=group)
1092        return data
1093
1094    elif rank == dst:
1095        tensor_size = torch.tensor(
1096            [0], dtype=torch.long, device=torch.cuda.current_device()
1097        )
1098        dist.recv(tensor_size, src=src, group=group)
1099        size = tensor_size.item()
1100
1101        if size == 0:
1102            return []
1103
1104        tensor_data = torch.empty(
1105            size, dtype=torch.uint8, device=torch.cuda.current_device()
1106        )
1107        dist.recv(tensor_data, src=src, group=group)
1108
1109        serialized_data = bytes(
1110            tensor_data.cpu().numpy()
1111        )  # Move back to host for deserialization
1112        data = pickle.loads(serialized_data)
1113        return data
1114
1115    # Other ranks in pp_group do nothing
1116    return []
1117

1119step_counter = 0
1120
1121
1122def pytorch_profile(name, func, *args, data_size=-1):
1123    """
1124    Args:
1125        name (string): the name of recorded function.
1126        func: the function to be profiled.
1127        args: the arguments of the profiled function.
1128        data_size (int): some measurement of the computation complexity.
1129            Usually, it could be the batch size.
1130    """
1131    global step_counter
1132    os.makedirs("trace", exist_ok=True)
1133    with profile(
1134        activities=[ProfilerActivity.CPU, ProfilerActivity.CUDA],
1135        # schedule=torch.profiler.schedule(wait=1, warmup=1, active=3, repeat=2),
1136        # on_trace_ready=tensorboard_trace_handler('./log_dir'),
1137        record_shapes=True,
1138        profile_memory=True,
1139        with_stack=True,
1140    ) as prof:
1141        with record_function(name):
1142            with open(f"trace/size_{step_counter}.json", "w") as f:
1143                json.dump({"size": data_size}, f)
1144            result = func(*args)
1145    prof.export_chrome_trace(f"trace/{name}_{step_counter}.json")
1146    step_counter += 1
1147    return result

1150def get_zmq_socket(
1151    context: zmq.Context, socket_type: zmq.SocketType, endpoint: str, bind: bool
1152):
1153    mem = psutil.virtual_memory()
1154    total_mem = mem.total / 1024**3
1155    available_mem = mem.available / 1024**3
1156    if total_mem > 32 and available_mem > 16:
1157        buf_size = int(0.5 * 1024**3)
1158    else:
1159        buf_size = -1
1160
1161    socket = context.socket(socket_type)
1162    if endpoint.find("[") != -1:
1163        socket.setsockopt(zmq.IPV6, 1)
1164
1165    def set_send_opt():
1166        socket.setsockopt(zmq.SNDHWM, 0)
1167        socket.setsockopt(zmq.SNDBUF, buf_size)
1168
1169    def set_recv_opt():
1170        socket.setsockopt(zmq.RCVHWM, 0)
1171        socket.setsockopt(zmq.RCVBUF, buf_size)
1172
1173    if socket_type == zmq.PUSH:
1174        set_send_opt()
1175    elif socket_type == zmq.PULL:
1176        set_recv_opt()
1177    elif socket_type == zmq.DEALER:
1178        set_send_opt()
1179        set_recv_opt()
1180    else:
1181        raise ValueError(f"Unsupported socket type: {socket_type}")
1182
1183    if bind:
1184        socket.bind(endpoint)
1185    else:
1186        socket.connect(endpoint)
1187
1188    return socket
1189

1191def dump_to_file(dirpath, name, value):
1192    from sglang.srt.distributed import get_tensor_model_parallel_rank
1193
1194    if get_tensor_model_parallel_rank() != 0:
1195        return
1196
1197    os.makedirs(dirpath, exist_ok=True)
1198    if value.dtype is torch.bfloat16:
1199        value = value.float()
1200    value = value.cpu().numpy()
1201    output_filename = os.path.join(dirpath, f"pytorch_dump_{name}.npy")
1202    logger.info(f"Dump a tensor to {output_filename}. Shape = {value.shape}")
1203    np.save(output_filename, value)

1206def is_triton_3():
1207    return triton.__version__.startswith("3.")

1210def maybe_torch_compile(*args, **kwargs):
1211    """
1212    torch.compile does not work for triton 2.2.0, which is needed in xlm1's jax.
1213    Therefore, we disable it here.
1214    """
1215
1216    def decorator(func):
1217        if is_triton_3():
1218            return torch.compile(*args, **kwargs)(func)
1219        return func
1220
1221    return decorator

1232# Temporary directory for prometheus multiprocess mode
1233# Cleaned up automatically when this object is garbage collected
1234prometheus_multiproc_dir: tempfile.TemporaryDirectory

1237def set_prometheus_multiproc_dir():
1238    # Set prometheus multiprocess directory
1239    # sglang uses prometheus multiprocess mode
1240    # we need to set this before importing prometheus_client
1241    # https://prometheus.github.io/client_python/multiprocess/
1242    global prometheus_multiproc_dir
1243
1244    if "PROMETHEUS_MULTIPROC_DIR" in os.environ:
1245        logger.debug("User set PROMETHEUS_MULTIPROC_DIR detected.")
1246        prometheus_multiproc_dir = tempfile.TemporaryDirectory(
1247            dir=os.environ["PROMETHEUS_MULTIPROC_DIR"]
1248        )
1249    else:
1250        prometheus_multiproc_dir = tempfile.TemporaryDirectory()
1251        os.environ["PROMETHEUS_MULTIPROC_DIR"] = prometheus_multiproc_dir.name
1252    logger.debug(f"PROMETHEUS_MULTIPROC_DIR: {os.environ['PROMETHEUS_MULTIPROC_DIR']}")

1255def add_prometheus_middleware(app):
1256    # We need to import prometheus_client after setting the env variable `PROMETHEUS_MULTIPROC_DIR`
1257    from prometheus_client import CollectorRegistry, make_asgi_app, multiprocess
1258
1259    registry = CollectorRegistry()
1260    multiprocess.MultiProcessCollector(registry)
1261    metrics_route = Mount("/metrics", make_asgi_app(registry=registry))
1262
1263    # Workaround for 307 Redirect for /metrics
1264    metrics_route.path_regex = re.compile("^/metrics(?P<path>.*)$")
1265    app.routes.append(metrics_route)

1268def bind_port(port):
1269    """Bind to a specific port, assuming it's available."""
1270    sock = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM)
1271    sock.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_REUSEADDR, 1)  # Allows address reuse
1272    sock.bind(("", port))
1273    sock.listen(1)
1274    return sock

1277def get_amdgpu_memory_capacity():
1278    try:
1279        # Run rocm-smi and capture the output
1280        result = subprocess.run(
1281            [
1282                "rocminfo | grep 'gfx' -A 100 | grep 'Pool 1' -A 5 | grep 'Size:' | awk '{print $2}'"
1283            ],
1284            stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
1285            stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
1286            shell=True,
1287            text=True,
1288        )
1289        if result.returncode != 0:
1290            raise RuntimeError(f"rocm-smi error: {result.stderr.strip()}")
1291
1292        # Parse the output to extract memory values in MiB
1293        memory_values = [
1294            float(mem.split("(")[0].strip()) / 1024
1295            for mem in result.stdout.strip().split("\n")
1296        ]
1297
1298        if not memory_values:
1299            raise ValueError("No GPU memory values found.")
1300
1301        # Return the minimum memory value
1302        return min(memory_values)
1303
1304    except FileNotFoundError:
1305        raise RuntimeError(
1306            "rocm-smi not found. Ensure AMD ROCm drivers are installed and accessible."
1307        )

1310def get_device_sm():
1311    if torch.cuda.is_available():

1313        return major * 10 + minor
1314    return 0

1317def get_nvgpu_memory_capacity():
1318    try:
1319        # Run nvidia-smi and capture the output
1320        result = subprocess.run(
1321            ["nvidia-smi", "--query-gpu=memory.total", "--format=csv,noheader,nounits"],
1322            stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
1323            stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
1324            text=True,
1325        )
1326
1327        if result.returncode != 0:
1328            raise RuntimeError(f"nvidia-smi error: {result.stderr.strip()}")
1329
1330        # Parse the output to extract memory values
1331        memory_values = [
1332            float(mem)
1333            for mem in result.stdout.strip().split("\n")
1334            if re.match(r"^\d+(\.\d+)?$", mem.strip())
1335        ]
1336
1337        if not memory_values:
1338            # Fallback to torch.cuda.mem_get_info() when failed to get memory capacity from nvidia-smi,
1339            # typically in NVIDIA MIG mode.
1340            if torch.cuda.is_available():
1341                logger.warning(
1342                    "Failed to get GPU memory capacity from nvidia-smi, falling back to torch.cuda.mem_get_info()."
1343                )
1344                return torch.cuda.mem_get_info()[1] // 1024 // 1024  # unit: MB
1345            raise ValueError("No GPU memory values found.")
1346
1347        # Return the minimum memory value
1348        return min(memory_values)
1349
1350    except FileNotFoundError:
1351        raise RuntimeError(
1352            "nvidia-smi not found. Ensure NVIDIA drivers are installed and accessible."
1353        )
1354
1355
1356def get_hpu_memory_capacity():
1357    try:
1358        # Run hl-smi and capture the output
1359        result = subprocess.run(
1360            ["hl-smi --query | grep 'Total'"],
1361            stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
1362            stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
1363            shell=True,
1364            text=True,
1365        )
1366
1367        if result.returncode != 0:
1368            raise RuntimeError(f"hl-smi error: {result.stderr.strip()}")
1369
1370        # Parse the output to extract memory values in MiB
1371        memory_values = [
1372            float(mem.split(" ")[-2]) for mem in result.stdout.strip().split("\n")
1373        ]
1374
1375        if not memory_values:
1376            raise ValueError("No GPU memory values found.")
1377
1378        # Return the minimum memory value
1379        return min(memory_values)
1380
1381    except FileNotFoundError:
1382        raise RuntimeError(
1383            "hl-smi not found. Ensure Habana drivers are installed and accessible."
1384        )

1387def get_npu_memory_capacity():
1388    try:
1389        import torch_npu
1390
1391        return torch.npu.mem_get_info()[1] // 1024 // 1024  # unit: MB
1392    except ImportError as e:
1393        raise ImportError("torch_npu is required when run on npu device.")

1396def get_device_memory_capacity(device: str = None):
1397    if is_cuda():
1398        gpu_mem = get_nvgpu_memory_capacity()
1399    elif is_hip():
1400        gpu_mem = get_amdgpu_memory_capacity()
1401    elif device == "hpu":
1402        gpu_mem = get_hpu_memory_capacity()
1403    elif device == "npu":
1404        gpu_mem = get_npu_memory_capacity()
1405    else:
1406        # GPU memory is not known yet or no GPU is available.
1407        gpu_mem = None
1408
1409    return gpu_mem

1412# Copy from pytorch and OpenRLHF to allow creating multiple main groups.
1413# https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/main/torch/distributed/distributed_c10d.py
1414# https://github.com/OpenRLHF/OpenRLHF/blob/main/openrlhf/utils/distributed_util.py
1415def init_custom_process_group(
1416    backend=None,
1417    init_method=None,
1418    timeout=None,
1419    world_size=-1,
1420    rank=-1,
1421    store=None,
1422    group_name=None,
1423    pg_options=None,
1424):
1425    from torch.distributed.distributed_c10d import (
1426        Backend,
1427        PrefixStore,
1428        _new_process_group_helper,
1429        _world,
1430        default_pg_timeout,
1431        rendezvous,
1432    )
1433
1434    assert (store is None) or (
1435        init_method is None
1436    ), "Cannot specify both init_method and store."
1437
1438    if store is not None:
1439        assert world_size > 0, "world_size must be positive if using store"
1440        assert rank >= 0, "rank must be non-negative if using store"
1441    elif init_method is None:
1442        init_method = "env://"
1443
1444    if backend:
1445        backend = Backend(backend)
1446    else:
1447        backend = Backend("undefined")
1448
1449    if timeout is None:
1450        timeout = default_pg_timeout
1451
1452    # backward compatible API
1453    if store is None:
1454        rendezvous_iterator = rendezvous(init_method, rank, world_size, timeout=timeout)
1455        store, rank, world_size = next(rendezvous_iterator)
1456        store.set_timeout(timeout)
1457
1458        # Use a PrefixStore to avoid accidental overrides of keys used by
1459        # different systems (e.g. RPC) in case the store is multi-tenant.
1460        store = PrefixStore(group_name, store)
1461
1462    # NOTE: The pg_options parameter was renamed into backend_options in PyTorch 2.6.0
1463    # https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/commit/a0c7029a75628cd5fa8df83c0de0ea98ee7fd844
1464    # We need to determine the appropriate parameter name based on PyTorch version
1465    pg_options_param_name = (
1466        "backend_options" if str(torch.__version__) >= "2.6" else "pg_options"
1467    )
1468    pg, _ = _new_process_group_helper(
1469        world_size,
1470        rank,
1471        [],
1472        backend,
1473        store,
1474        group_name=group_name,
1475        **{pg_options_param_name: pg_options},
1476        timeout=timeout,
1477    )
1478
1479    _world.pg_group_ranks[pg] = {i: i for i in range(world_size)}
1480
1481    return pg
1482

1518@lru_cache(maxsize=8)
1519def get_device(device_id: Optional[int] = None) -> str:
1520    if is_cpu():
1521        if cpu_has_amx_support():
1522            logger.info("Intel AMX is detected, using CPU with Intel AMX support.")
1523        else:
1524            logger.warning(
1525                "CPU device enabled, using torch native backend, low performance expected."
1526            )
1527        return "cpu"
1528
1529    if hasattr(torch, "cuda") and torch.cuda.is_available():
1530        if device_id is None:
1531            return "cuda"
1532        return "cuda:{}".format(device_id)
1533
1534    if hasattr(torch, "xpu") and torch.xpu.is_available():
1535        if device_id == None:
1536            return "xpu"
1537        return "xpu:{}".format(device_id)
1538
1539    if hasattr(torch, "npu") and torch.npu.is_available():
1540        if device_id == None:
1541            return "npu"
1542        return "npu:{}".format(device_id)
1543
1544    if is_habana_available():
1545        try:
1546            import habana_frameworks.torch.hpu
1547
1548            if torch.hpu.is_available():
1549                if device_id == None:
1550                    return "hpu"
1551                return "hpu:{}".format(device_id)
1552        except ImportError as e:
1553            raise ImportError(
1554                "Habana frameworks detected, but failed to import 'habana_frameworks.torch.hpu'."
1555            )
1556
1557    raise RuntimeError("No accelerator (CUDA, XPU, HPU) is available.")
1558

1560@lru_cache(maxsize=1)
1561def get_device_count() -> int:
1562    if hasattr(torch, "cuda") and torch.cuda.is_available():
1563        try:
1564            return torch.cuda.device_count()
1565        except RuntimeError:
1566            return 0
1567
1568    if hasattr(torch, "xpu") and torch.xpu.is_available():
1569        try:
1570            return torch.xpu.device_count()
1571        except RuntimeError:
1572            return 0
1573
1574    if is_habana_available():
1575        try:
1576            import habana_frameworks.torch.hpu
1577
1578            if torch.hpu.is_available():
1579                return torch.hpu.device_count()
1580        except (ImportError, RuntimeError):
1581            return 0
1582
1583    return 0  # No accelerators available

1593def get_device_capability(device_id: int = 0) -> Tuple[int, int]:
1594    major, minor = None, None
1595    if hasattr(torch, "cuda") and torch.cuda.is_available():
1596        major, minor = torch.cuda.get_device_capability(device_id)
1597
1598    if hasattr(torch, "xpu") and torch.xpu.is_available():
1599        major, minor, *_ = torch.xpu.get_device_capability(device_id)["version"].split(
1600            "."
1601        )
1602        major, minor = int(major), int(minor)
1603
1604    if hasattr(torch, "hpu") and torch.hpu.is_available():
1605        try:
1606            # TODO(HandH1998): `get_device_capability` is not supported by `torch.hpu` for now.
1607            # Update this once the support is available.
1608            # major, minor = torch.hpu.get_device_capability(device_id)
1609            major, minor = None, None
1610        except Exception as e:
1611            raise RuntimeError(
1612                f"An error occurred while getting device capability of hpu: {e}."
1613            ) from e
1614
1615    return major, minor

1618def get_npu_compiler_config():
1619    config = {
1620        "frozen_parameter": True,
1621        "tiling_schedule_optimize": True,
1622        "topology_sorting_strategy": "StableRDFS",
1623    }
1624    return config

1627def get_compiler_backend() -> str:
1628    if hasattr(torch, "hpu") and torch.hpu.is_available():
1629        return "hpu_backend"
1630
1631    if hasattr(torch, "npu") and torch.npu.is_available():
1632        try:
1633            import torchair
1634            import torchair.ge_concrete_graph.ge_converter.experimental.patch_for_hcom_allreduce
1635            from torchair.configs.compiler_config import CompilerConfig
1636        except ImportError as e:
1637            raise ImportError(
1638                "NPU detected, but torchair package is not installed. "
1639                "Please install torchair for torch.compile support on NPU."
1640            )
1641        compiler_config = CompilerConfig()
1642        predefined_config = get_npu_compiler_config()
1643        for k, v in predefined_config.items():
1644            setattr(compiler_config.experimental_config, k, v)
1645
1646        npu_backend = torchair.get_npu_backend(compiler_config=compiler_config)
1647        return npu_backend
1648
1649    return "inductor"

1655# Some backends use pytorch version < 2.4.0 which doesn't
1656# support `torch.library.custom_op`.
1657def supports_custom_op() -> bool:
1658    return hasattr(torch.library, "custom_op")

1660
1661def direct_register_custom_op(
1662    op_name: str,
1663    op_func: Callable,
1664    mutates_args: List[str],
1665    fake_impl: Optional[Callable] = None,
1666    target_lib: Optional[Library] = None,
1667):
1668    """
1669    `torch.library.custom_op` can have significant overhead because it
1670    needs to consider complicated dispatching logic. This function
1671    directly registers a custom op and dispatches it to the CUDA backend.
1672    See https://gist.github.com/youkaichao/ecbea9ec9fc79a45d2adce1784d7a9a5
1673    for more details.
1674
1675    By default, the custom op is registered to the vLLM library. If you
1676    want to register it to a different library, you can pass the library
1677    object to the `target_lib` argument.
1678
1679    IMPORTANT: the lifetime of the operator is tied to the lifetime of the
1680    library object. If you want to bind the operator to a different library,
1681    make sure the library object is alive when the operator is used.
1682
1683    Note: This function will silently skip registration if the operator
1684    with the same name is already registered to avoid RuntimeError in
1685    multi-engine scenarios (e.g., VERL framework).
1686    """
1687    import torch.library
1688
1689    my_lib = target_lib or sglang_lib
1690
1691    # Check if operator is already registered to avoid duplicate registration
1692    # This is important for scenarios where multiple SGLang engines run in the same process
1693    try:
1694        # Try to access the operator to see if it's already registered
1695        lib_name = my_lib.m.name if hasattr(my_lib.m, "name") else "sglang"
1696        if hasattr(torch.ops, lib_name) and hasattr(
1697            getattr(torch.ops, lib_name), op_name
1698        ):
1699            # Operator already exists, skip registration
1700            return
1701    except (AttributeError, RuntimeError):
1702        # Operator doesn't exist, proceed with registration
1703        pass
1704
1705    if hasattr(torch.library, "infer_schema"):
1706        schema_str = torch.library.infer_schema(op_func, mutates_args=mutates_args)
1707    else:
1708        # for pytorch 2.4
1709        import torch._custom_op.impl
1710
1711        schema_str = torch._custom_op.impl.infer_schema(op_func, mutates_args)
1712
1713    try:
1714        my_lib.define(op_name + schema_str)
1715        my_lib.impl(op_name, op_func, "CUDA")
1716        if fake_impl is not None:
1717            my_lib._register_fake(op_name, fake_impl)
1718    except RuntimeError as error:
1719        if "Tried to register an operator" in str(e) and "multiple times" in str(e):
1720            # Silently ignore duplicate registration errors
1721            # This can happen in multi-engine scenarios
1722            pass
1723        else:
1724            # Re-raise other RuntimeErrors
1725            raise error
1726    except AttributeError as error:
1727        # Always re-raise AttributeError as it indicates missing dependencies
1728        raise error
1729
1730
1731def set_gpu_proc_affinity(
1732    tp_size: int,
1733    nnodes: int,
1734    gpu_id: int,
1735):
1736    # current process
1737    pid = os.getpid()
1738    p = psutil.Process(pid)
1739
1740    tp_size_per_node = tp_size // nnodes
1741
1742    # total physical cores
1743    total_pcores = psutil.cpu_count(logical=False)
1744    # physical cores per TP (N.B. more Cores than GPUs on node)
1745    num_cores_bind = total_pcores // tp_size_per_node
1746
1747    # able to handle multiple DP per node
1748    start_cpu_id = (gpu_id * num_cores_bind) % total_pcores
1749    end_cpu_id = start_cpu_id + num_cores_bind
1750
1751    if psutil.cpu_count() != psutil.cpu_count(logical=False):
1752        # HT on
1753        lower_cpu_ids = [id for id in range(start_cpu_id, end_cpu_id)]
1754        upper_cpu_ids = [id + total_pcores for id in range(start_cpu_id, end_cpu_id)]
1755        bind_cpu_ids = list(itertools.chain(lower_cpu_ids, upper_cpu_ids))
1756    else:
1757        # HT off
1758        bind_cpu_ids = [id for id in range(start_cpu_id, end_cpu_id)]
1759
1760    # set cpu_affinity to current process
1761    p.cpu_affinity(bind_cpu_ids)
1762    logger.info(f"Process {pid} gpu_id {gpu_id} is running on CPUs: {p.cpu_affinity()}")
1763

1770def dataclass_to_string_truncated(
1771    data, max_length=2048, skip_names: Optional[Set[str]] = None
1772):
1773    if skip_names is None:
1774        skip_names = set()
1775    if isinstance(data, str):
1776        if len(data) > max_length:
1777            half_length = max_length // 2
1778            return f"{repr(data[:half_length])} ... {repr(data[-half_length:])}"
1779        else:
1780            return f"{repr(data)}"
1781    elif isinstance(data, (list, tuple)):
1782        if len(data) > max_length:
1783            half_length = max_length // 2
1784            return str(data[:half_length]) + " ... " + str(data[-half_length:])
1785        else:
1786            return str(data)
1787    elif isinstance(data, dict):
1788        return (
1789            "{"
1790            + ", ".join(
1791                f"'{k}': {dataclass_to_string_truncated(v, max_length)}"
1792                for k, v in data.items()
1793                if k not in skip_names
1794            )
1795            + "}"
1796        )
1797    elif dataclasses.is_dataclass(data):
1798        fields = dataclasses.fields(data)
1799        return (
1800            f"{data.__class__.__name__}("
1801            + ", ".join(
1802                f"{f.name}={dataclass_to_string_truncated(getattr(data, f.name), max_length)}"
1803                for f in fields
1804                if f.name not in skip_names
1805            )
1806            + ")"
1807        )
1808    else:
1809        return str(data)
1810
1811
1812def permute_weight(x: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor:
1813    b_ = x.shape[0]
1814    n_ = x.shape[1]
1815    k_ = x.shape[2]
1816
1817    x_ = x
1818    if x.dtype == torch.bfloat16 or x.dtype == torch.float16:
1819        x_ = x_.view(int(b_), int(n_ / 16), 16, int(k_ / 32), 4, 8)
1820    elif x.dtype == torch.float8_e4m3fnuz or x.dtype == torch.int8:
1821        x_ = x_.view(int(b_), int(n_ / 16), 16, int(k_ / 64), 4, 16)
1822    else:
1823        # return x_
1824        x_ = x_.view(int(b_), int(n_ / 16), 16, int(k_ / 8), 2, 4)
1825
1826    x_ = x_.permute(0, 1, 3, 4, 2, 5)
1827    x_ = x_.contiguous()
1828    x_ = x_.view(*x.shape)
1829    return x_
1830
1831
1832class MultiprocessingSerializer:
1833    @staticmethod
1834    def serialize(obj, output_str: bool = False):
1835        """
1836        Serialize a Python object using ForkingPickler.
1837
1838        Args:
1839            obj: The object to serialize.
1840            output_str (bool): If True, return a base64-encoded string instead of raw bytes.
1841
1842        Returns:
1843            bytes or str: The serialized object.
1844        """
1845        buf = io.BytesIO()
1846        ForkingPickler(buf).dump(obj)
1847        buf.seek(0)
1848        output = buf.read()
1849
1850        if output_str:
1851            # Convert bytes to base64-encoded string
1852            output = pybase64.b64encode(output).decode("utf-8")
1853
1854        return output
1855
1856    @staticmethod
1857    def deserialize(data):
1858        """
1859        Deserialize a previously serialized object.
1860
1861        Args:
1862            data (bytes or str): The serialized data, optionally base64-encoded.
1863
1864        Returns:
1865            The deserialized Python object.
1866        """
1867        if isinstance(data, str):
1868            # Decode base64 string to bytes
1869            data = pybase64.b64decode(data, validate=True)
1870
1871        return ForkingPickler.loads(data)
1872
1873
1874def debug_timing(func):
1875    # todo: replace with a more organized instrumentation
1876    def wrapper(*args, **kwargs):
1877        if logger.isEnabledFor(logging.DEBUG):
1878            tic = torch.cuda.Event(enable_timing=True)
1879            toc = torch.cuda.Event(enable_timing=True)
1880            tic.record()
1881            result = func(*args, **kwargs)
1882            toc.record()
1883            toc.synchronize()  # Wait for the function to complete without synchronizing all ops on the GPU
1884            elapsed = tic.elapsed_time(toc)
1885            indices = kwargs.get("indices", args[1] if len(args) > 1 else None)
1886            num_tokens = len(indices) if indices is not None else 0
1887            throughput = num_tokens / elapsed * 1000 if elapsed > 0 else 0
1888            logger.debug(
1889                f"Transfer time: {elapsed} ms, throughput: {throughput} tokens/s"
1890            )
1891            return result
1892        else:
1893            return func(*args, **kwargs)
1894
1895    return wrapper

1904def pyspy_dump_schedulers():

1911            cmd, shell=True, capture_output=True, text=True, check=True

1913        logger.error(f"Pyspy dump for PID {pid}:\n{result.stdout}")

1915        logger.error(f"Pyspy failed to dump PID {pid}. Error: {e.stderr}")

1941def get_ip() -> str:
1942    # SGLANG_HOST_IP env can be ignore
1943    host_ip = os.getenv("SGLANG_HOST_IP", "") or os.getenv("HOST_IP", "")
1944    if host_ip:
1945        return host_ip
1946
1947    # IP is not set, try to get it from the network interface
1948
1949    # try ipv4
1950    s = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_DGRAM)
1951    try:
1952        s.connect(("8.8.8.8", 80))  # Doesn't need to be reachable
1953        return s.getsockname()[0]
1954    except Exception:
1955        pass
1956
1957    # try ipv6
1958    try:
1959        s = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET6, socket.SOCK_DGRAM)
1960        # Google's public DNS server, see
1961        # https://developers.google.com/speed/public-dns/docs/using#addresses
1962        s.connect(("2001:4860:4860::8888", 80))  # Doesn't need to be reachable
1963        return s.getsockname()[0]
1964    except Exception:
1965        pass
1966
1967    # try  using hostname
1968    hostname = socket.gethostname()
1969    try:
1970        ip_addr = socket.gethostbyname(hostname)
1971        warnings.warn("using local ip address: {}".format(ip_addr))
1972        return ip_addr
1973    except Exception:
1974        pass
1975
1976    warnings.warn(
1977        "Failed to get the IP address, using 0.0.0.0 by default."
1978        "The value can be set by the environment variable"
1979        " SGLANG_HOST_IP or HOST_IP.",
1980        stacklevel=2,
1981    )
1982    return "0.0.0.0"
1983
1984
1985def get_open_port() -> int:
1986    port = os.getenv("SGLANG_PORT")
1987    if port is not None:
1988        port = int(port)
1989        while True:
1990            try:
1991                with socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM) as s:
1992                    s.bind(("", port))
1993                    return port
1994            except OSError:
1995                port += 1  # Increment port number if already in use
1996                logger.info("Port %d is already in use, trying port %d", port - 1, port)
1997    # try ipv4
1998    try:
1999        with socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM) as s:
2000            s.bind(("", 0))
2001            return s.getsockname()[1]
2002    except OSError:
2003        # try ipv6
2004        with socket.socket(socket.AF_INET6, socket.SOCK_STREAM) as s:
2005            s.bind(("", 0))
2006            return s.getsockname()[1]

2009def is_valid_ipv6_address(address: str) -> bool:
2010    try:
2011        ipaddress.IPv6Address(address)
2012        return True
2013    except ValueError:
2014        return False

2017def maybe_wrap_ipv6_address(address: str) -> str:
2018    if is_valid_ipv6_address(address):
2019        return f"[{address}]"
2020    return address

2023def format_tcp_address(ip: str, port: int) -> str:

2027def configure_ipv6(dist_init_addr):
2028    addr = dist_init_addr
2029    end = addr.find("]")
2030    if end == -1:
2031        raise ValueError("invalid IPv6 address format: missing ']'")
2032
2033    host = addr[: end + 1]
2034
2035    # this only validates the address without brackets: we still need the below checks.
2036    # if it's invalid, immediately raise an error so we know it's not formatting issues.
2037    if not is_valid_ipv6_address(host[1:end]):
2038        raise ValueError(f"invalid IPv6 address: {host}")
2039
2040    port_str = None
2041    if len(addr) > end + 1:
2042        if addr[end + 1] == ":":
2043            port_str = addr[end + 2 :]
2044        else:
2045            raise ValueError("received IPv6 address format: expected ':' after ']'")
2046
2047    if not port_str:
2048        raise ValueError(
2049            "a port must be specified in IPv6 address (format: [ipv6]:port)"
2050        )
2051
2052    try:
2053        port = int(port_str)
2054    except ValueError:
2055        raise ValueError(f"invalid port in IPv6 address: '{port_str}'")
2056    return port, host

2059def launch_dummy_health_check_server(host, port, enable_metrics):
2060    import asyncio
2061

2069        """Check the health of the http server."""
2070        return Response(status_code=200)

2072    @app.get("/health_generate")
2073    async def health_generate():
2074        """Check the health of the http server."""
2075        return Response(status_code=200)
2076
2077    # Add prometheus middleware
2078    if enable_metrics:
2079        add_prometheus_middleware(app)
2080        enable_func_timer()
2081

2083        app,
2084        host=host,
2085        port=port,
2086        timeout_keep_alive=5,
2087        loop="auto",
2088        log_config=None,
2089        log_level="warning",

2096            f"Dummy health check server scheduled on existing loop at {host}:{port}"
2097        )

2100    except RuntimeError:
2101        logger.info(f"Starting dummy health check server at {host}:{port}")

2152def is_remote_url(url: Union[str, Path]) -> bool:
2153    """
2154    Check if the URL is a remote URL of the format:
2155    <connector_type>://<host>:<port>/<model_name>
2156    """
2157    if isinstance(url, Path):
2158        return False
2159
2160    pattern = r"(.+)://(.*)"
2161    m = re.match(pattern, url)
2162    return m is not None
2163
2164
2165def parse_connector_type(url: str) -> str:
2166    """
2167    Parse the connector type from the URL of the format:
2168    <connector_type>://<path>
2169    """
2170    pattern = r"(.+)://(.*)"
2171    m = re.match(pattern, url)
2172    if m is None:
2173        return ""
2174
2175    return m.group(1)

2178def retry(
2179    fn,
2180    max_retry: int,
2181    initial_delay: float = 2.0,
2182    max_delay: float = 60.0,
2183    should_retry: Callable[[Any], bool] = lambda e: True,
2184):
2185    for try_index in itertools.count():
2186        try:
2187            return fn()
2188        except Exception as e:
2189            if try_index >= max_retry:
2190                raise Exception(f"retry() exceed maximum number of retries.")
2191
2192            if not should_retry(e):
2193                raise Exception(f"retry() observe errors that should not be retried.")
2194
2195            delay = min(initial_delay * (2**try_index), max_delay) * (
2196                0.75 + 0.25 * random.random()
2197            )
2198
2199            logger.warning(
2200                f"retry() failed once ({try_index}th try, maximum {max_retry} retries). Will delay {delay:.2f}s and retry. Error: {e}"
2201            )
2202            traceback.print_exc()
2203
2204            time.sleep(delay)
2205

2207def flatten_nested_list(nested_list):
2208    if isinstance(nested_list, list):
2209        return [
2210            item for sublist in nested_list for item in flatten_nested_list(sublist)
2211        ]
2212    else:
2213        return [nested_list]

2224def fast_topk(values, topk, dim):
2225    if topk == 1:
2226        # Use max along the specified dimension to get both value and index
2227        return torch.max(values, dim=dim, keepdim=True)
2228    else:
2229        # Use topk for efficiency with larger k values
2230        return torch.topk(values, topk, dim=dim)

2241def get_local_ip_auto() -> str:
2242    interface = os.environ.get("SGLANG_LOCAL_IP_NIC", None)
2243    return (
2244        get_local_ip_by_nic(interface)
2245        if interface is not None
2246        else get_local_ip_by_remote()

2250def get_local_ip_by_nic(interface: str) -> str:
2251    try:
2252        import netifaces
2253    except ImportError as e:
2254        raise ImportError(
2255            "Environment variable SGLANG_LOCAL_IP_NIC requires package netifaces, please install it through 'pip install netifaces'"
2256        ) from e
2257
2258    try:
2259        addresses = netifaces.ifaddresses(interface)
2260        if netifaces.AF_INET in addresses:
2261            for addr_info in addresses[netifaces.AF_INET]:
2262                ip = addr_info.get("addr")
2263                if ip and ip != "127.0.0.1" and ip != "0.0.0.0":
2264                    return ip
2265        if netifaces.AF_INET6 in addresses:
2266            for addr_info in addresses[netifaces.AF_INET6]:
2267                ip = addr_info.get("addr")
2268                if ip and not ip.startswith("fe80::") and ip != "::1":
2269                    return ip.split("%")[0]
2270    except (ValueError, OSError) as e:
2271        raise ValueError(
2272            "Can not get local ip from NIC. Please verify whether SGLANG_LOCAL_IP_NIC is set correctly."
2273        )
2274
2275    # Fallback
2276    return get_local_ip_by_remote()
2277
2278
2279def get_local_ip_by_remote() -> str:
2280    # try ipv4
2281    s = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_DGRAM)
2282    try:
2283        s.connect(("8.8.8.8", 80))  # Doesn't need to be reachable
2284        return s.getsockname()[0]
2285    except Exception:
2286        pass
2287
2288    try:
2289        hostname = socket.gethostname()
2290        ip = socket.gethostbyname(hostname)
2291        if ip and ip != "127.0.0.1" and ip != "0.0.0.0":
2292            return ip
2293    except Exception:
2294        pass
2295
2296    # try ipv6
2297    try:
2298        s = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET6, socket.SOCK_DGRAM)
2299        # Google's public DNS server, see
2300        # https://developers.google.com/speed/public-dns/docs/using#addresses
2301        s.connect(("2001:4860:4860::8888", 80))  # Doesn't need to be reachable
2302        return s.getsockname()[0]
2303    except Exception:
2304        raise ValueError("Can not get local ip")

2340# Can be more general if it is used in multiple places (keep it simple and thus not general now)
2341class BumpAllocator:
2342    def __init__(self, buffer_size: int, dtype, device):
2343        self._buffer = torch.zeros((buffer_size,), dtype=dtype, device=device)
2344        self._pointer = 0
2345
2346    def allocate(self, size: int):
2347        assert self._pointer + size <= len(self._buffer)
2348        output = self._buffer[self._pointer : self._pointer + size]
2349        self._pointer += size
2350        return output

2371T = TypeVar("T")
2372
2373
2374class Withable(Generic[T]):
2375    def __init__(self):
2376        self._value: Optional[T] = None
2377
2378    @property
2379    def value(self) -> T:
2380        return self._value
2381
2382    @contextmanager
2383    def with_value(self, new_value: T):
2384        assert self._value is None
2385        self._value = new_value
2386        try:
2387            yield
2388        finally:
2389            assert self._value is new_value
2390            self._value = None

2393def require_mlp_tp_gather(server_args):
2394    """
2395    Check if the input of MLP is obtained by all-gather rather than all-reduce. This only happens when each MLP TP group contains multiple attention DP groups.
2396    """
2397    if server_args.enable_dp_attention:
2398        assert server_args.dp_size > 1, "dp_size must be greater than 1"
2399        if (
2400            server_args.moe_dense_tp_size is None
2401        ):  # TODO(ch-wan): some MoE models do not have dense layers
2402            return True
2403        elif not server_args.enable_dp_lm_head:
2404            return True
2405        elif server_args.moe_a2a_backend == "none":
2406            return True
2407        else:
2408            return (
2409                server_args.moe_dense_tp_size
2410                > server_args.tp_size // server_args.dp_size
2411            )
2412    else:
2413        return False
2414
2415
2416def require_attn_tp_gather(server_args):
2417    """
2418    Check if the input of attention is scattered.
2419    """
2420    assert server_args.moe_dense_tp_size in [1, None]
2421    if server_args.moe_a2a_backend != "none" or server_args.moe_dense_tp_size == 1:
2422        if server_args.enable_dp_attention:
2423            return server_args.dp_size < server_args.tp_size
2424        else:
2425            return True
2426    else:
2427        return False
2428
2429
2430def require_gathered_buffer(server_args):
2431    return require_mlp_tp_gather(server_args) or require_attn_tp_gather(server_args)
2432
2433
2434def require_mlp_sync(server_args):
2435    return server_args.enable_dp_attention or require_gathered_buffer(server_args)
2436

2438def find_local_repo_dir(repo_id: str, revision: Optional[str] = None) -> Optional[str]:
2439    import huggingface_hub as hf
2440
2441    # Build cache path
2442    cache_path = os.path.join(
2443        hf.constants.HF_HUB_CACHE,
2444        hf.constants.REPO_ID_SEPARATOR.join(["models", *repo_id.split("/")]),
2445    )
2446
2447    # Get revision from main ref if not specified
2448    if not revision:
2449        ref_path = os.path.join(cache_path, "refs", "main")
2450        if os.path.isfile(ref_path):
2451            with open(ref_path) as f:
2452                revision = f.read().strip()
2453
2454    # List files from revision directory
2455    if revision:
2456        rev_dir = os.path.join(cache_path, "snapshots", revision)
2457        if os.path.isdir(rev_dir):
2458            return rev_dir
2459
2460    return None

2463def read_system_prompt_from_file(model_name: str) -> str:
2464    """Read system prompt from a file in the HuggingFace cache directory.
2465
2466    Args:
2467        model_name: The model name to construct the file path
2468
2469    Returns:
2470        The system prompt content from the file, or empty string if file not found
2471    """
2472    try:
2473        local_repo_dir = find_local_repo_dir(model_name)
2474        if local_repo_dir:
2475            system_prompt_file = os.path.join(local_repo_dir, "SYSTEM_PROMPT.txt")
2476            if os.path.exists(system_prompt_file):
2477                with open(system_prompt_file, "r", encoding="utf-8") as f:
2478                    return f.read()
2479
2480        return ""
2481    except Exception:
2482        # If anything fails, return empty string
2483        return ""

2494def prepack_weight_if_needed(weight):
2495    if weight.device != torch.device("cpu"):
2496        return weight
2497    if not cpu_has_amx_support():
2498        return weight
2499
2500    return torch.ops.sgl_kernel.convert_weight_packed(weight)
2501
2502
2503# TODO: currently gemm kernel has the below requirements:
2504# OC % TILE_N == 0, where TILE_N = 16
2505# IC % TILE_K == 0, where TILE_K = 32
2506def dim_is_supported(weight):
2507    return weight.size(0) % 16 == 0 and weight.size(1) % 32 == 0
2508
2509
2510def _process_weight_after_loading(module, weight_names, transpose_dims=None) -> None:
2511    # Pack weight for get better performance on CPU
2512    devices = {getattr(module, weight_name).device for weight_name in weight_names}
2513    assert len(devices) == 1, f"Expects all weights to be on the same device"
2514    device = devices.pop()
2515
2516    if transpose_dims:
2517        assert len(weight_names) == len(
2518            transpose_dims
2519        ), "len(weight_names) should be equal to len(transpose_dims)"
2520
2521    for i, weight_name in enumerate(weight_names):
2522        weight_tensor = getattr(module, weight_name)
2523
2524        # We don't pack weight or use intel amx backend if any weight of this module has unsupported dim.
2525        if not dim_is_supported(weight_tensor):
2526            logger.warning(
2527                f"Expects weight.size(0) % 16 == 0 and weight.size(1) % 32 == 0 "
2528                f"but {weight_tensor.size(0)=} and {weight_tensor.size(1)=} in {module}. "
2529                f"{module} won't use intel amx backend."
2530            )
2531            module.use_intel_amx_backend = False
2532            return
2533
2534        if transpose_dims and transpose_dims[i]:
2535            weight_tensor = weight_tensor.transpose(*transpose_dims[i])
2536
2537        packed_weight = torch.nn.Parameter(
2538            prepack_weight_if_needed(weight_tensor),
2539            requires_grad=False,
2540        )
2541        packed_weight.__dict__ = weight_tensor.__dict__
2542        setattr(module, weight_name, packed_weight)
2543
2544    module.use_intel_amx_backend = (
2545        device == torch.device("cpu") and cpu_has_amx_support()
2546    )
2547
2548    if (
2549        module.use_intel_amx_backend
2550        and hasattr(module, "bias")
2551        and module.bias is not None
2552    ):
2553        module.bias = torch.nn.Parameter(module.bias.data.float(), requires_grad=False)
2554
2555
2556class PackWeightMethod:
2557    def __init__(self, weight_names, transpose_dims=None):
2558        self.weight_names = weight_names
2559        self.transpose_dims = transpose_dims
2560
2561    def process_weights_after_loading(self, module) -> None:
2562        _process_weight_after_loading(module, self.weight_names, self.transpose_dims)

2565class LazyValue:
2566    def __init__(self, creator: Callable):
2567        self._creator = creator
2568        self._value = None
2569
2570    @property
2571    def value(self):
2572        if self._creator is not None:
2573            self._value = self._creator()
2574            self._creator = None
2575        return self._value

2578def dynamic_import(func_path: str):
2579    parts = func_path.split(".")
2580    if len(parts) < 2:
2581        raise ValueError(
2582            "func_path should contain both module name and func name (such as 'module.func')"
2583        )
2584    module_path = ".".join(parts[:-1])
2585    func_name = parts[-1]
2586    module = importlib.import_module(module_path)
2587    func = getattr(module, func_name)
2588    return func

2591def gc_object_counts():
2592    import gc
2593
2594    g0 = len(gc.get_objects(0))
2595    g1 = len(gc.get_objects(1))
2596    g2 = len(gc.get_objects(2))
2597    return g0, g1, g2

2600def configure_gc_warning(warn_threshold_secs):
2601    import gc
2602
2603    gc_start_time = {}
2604
2605    def gc_callback(phase, info):
2606        gen = info.get("generation", "?")
2607        if phase == "start":
2608            gc_start_time[gen] = time.time()
2609        elif phase == "stop":
2610            duration = time.time() - gc_start_time.get(gen, time.time())
2611            if duration > warn_threshold_secs:
2612                g0, g1, g2 = gc_object_counts()
2613                logger.warn(
2614                    f"LONG GARBAGE COLLECTION DETECTED | Generation {gen} | Duration: {duration:.4f}s | # Objects: gen0={g0}, gen1={g1}, gen2={g2} | "
2615                    f"This may cause latency jitter. Consider calling the freeze_gc API after sending a few warmup requests."
2616                )
2617
2618    gc.callbacks.append(gc_callback)
2619
2620
2621def freeze_gc(context: str):
2622    import gc
2623
2624    g0_before, g1_before, g2_before = gc_object_counts()
2625    gc.freeze()
2626    g0_after, g1_after, g2_after = gc_object_counts()
2627    logger.info(
2628        f"Freezing GC in {context} process. "
2629        f"gen0: {g0_before}->{g0_after}, "
2630        f"gen1: {g1_before}->{g1_after}, "
2631        f"gen2: {g2_before}->{g2_after}"
2632    )
2633
2634
2635def configure_gc_logger():
2636    logger.info("Enable GC Logger")
2637
2638    import gc
2639
2640    gc_start_time = {}
2641
2642    def gc_callback(phase, info):
2643        gen = info.get("generation", "?")
2644        if phase == "start":
2645            gc_start_time[gen] = time.time()
2646            logger.info(f"GC start: Time {time.time()} | Generation {gen}")
2647        elif phase == "stop":
2648            duration = time.time() - gc_start_time.get(gen, time.time())
2649            collected = info.get("collected", "?")
2650            uncollectable = info.get("uncollectable", "?")
2651            logger.info(
2652                f"GC end: Time {time.time()} | Generation {gen} | "
2653                f"Duration: {duration:.4f}s | Collected: {collected} | Uncollectable: {uncollectable} "
2654                f'{"(LONG GC)" if duration > 0.1 else ""}'
2655            )
2656
2657    gc.callbacks.append(gc_callback)
